statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ 6 \\ 16 \\ 4 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ 6 \\ 16 \\ 4 \end{array}\right].
